directors.name: Dr. Sami Azam
directors.title: Lab Director & Principal Investigator
directors.shortDescription: Sami Azam is currently a Leading Researcher and Professor with the Faculty of Science and Technology at Charles Darwin University, Casuarina, NT, Australia. He is actively involved in research in computer vision, signal processing, artificial intelligence, and biomedical engineering. He has published several works in peer-reviewed journals and international conference proceedings.

directors.name: Mohaimenul Azam Khan Raiaan
directors.title: Associate Director
directors.shortDescription: Mohaimenul Azam Khan Raiaan is a computer science engineer working remotely as a Consultant-Research Assistant, affiliated with Charles Darwin University, Australia. His research primarily focuses on Medical Image Analysis, Computer Vision, Explainable Artificial Intelligence, and Deep Learning.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

directors.name: Nur Mohammad Fahad
directors.title: Research Coordinator
directors.shortDescription: Nur Mohammad Fahad received a bachelor's degree from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, United International University (UIU), Bangladesh. During the bachelor's study, he has contributed to the academic community as an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant with the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, UIU. In addition to his teaching role, he has deeply engaged in cutting-edge research across several domains, including computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, health informatics, graph theory, and mental health modeling.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Arefin Ittesafun Abian
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Arefin Ittesafun Abian is a Computer Science Engineer who has completed her graduation from United International University. She is currently working under the supervision of Dr. Sami Azam in the PRISML Lab. Her research encompasses computer vision, artificial intelligence, deep learning, and medical image analysis, and she has a year of experience in 3D image and video processing.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Ripon Kumar Debnath
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Ripon Kumar Debnath received his Bachelor's in Computer Science and Engineering from United International University (UIU) in 2024. He is actively involved in research activities, especially in computer vision, natural language processing, and biomedical engineering, explainable artificial intelligence, and graph optimization. Notably, he has made significant contributions to the field, as evidenced by his research articles published in scopus-indexed conferences.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Debopom Sutradhar
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Debopom Sutradhar is enthusiastic and technologically savvy, with a strong interest in Machine Learning and Deep Learning. His research involves innovative applications of computer vision techniques. His recent projects include a cervical spine fracture detection system using YOLOv8 paired with a deep attention-based vertebrae classification method to ensure explainable AI. He also developed a lightweight encoder approach for predicting future changes in satellite imagery via semi-supervised learning. Debopom is currently working on CT scan denoising using reinforcement learning.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Abdur Rahman
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Abdur Rahman received his Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Engineering from United International University (UIU), Bangladesh in 2024. His research interests are primarily focused on computer vision, with a particular emphasis on multimodal medical image processing. Currently, he is working with the PRISML Lab at Charles Darwin University, Australia, under the supervision of Professor Dr. Sami Azam.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Tamanna Shermin
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Tamanna Shermin received her Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, bringing a strong foundation in programming and a deep interest in machine learning. She is currently conducting research in computer vision under the supervision of Dr. Sami Azam. Her primary research interests include Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Vision, and Natural Language Processing, with a focus on projects that drive impactful, innovative solutions on a global scale.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Md Fahmi Kazi
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Md Fahmi Kazi works as a software developer at All Generation Tech (AGT) and is currently engaged in research with the PRISML Lab, focusing on a project related to Semantic Image Augmentation. His research interests span Bioinformatics, Image Processing, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Eashrat Jahan
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: REashrat Jahan is currently a Lecturer in the Computer Science and Engineering Department at the Institute of Science, Trade and Technology. She is an active member of the PRISML Lab and is currently engaged in a project focused on Semantic Image Augmentation. Her research interests include Image Processing, Bioinformatics, and Human-Computer Interaction.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Shahil Yasar Haque
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Shahil Yasar Haque is currently an instructor at United International University (UIU). He is actively engaged in research, focusing on data augmentation techniques to expand the size and diversity of sparse image datasets. His research interests span large language models, diffusion models, natural language processing, and image processing.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University

graduate_research.name: Md. Jakarea
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Md. Jakarea, an Electrical and Electronic Engineering graduate from United International University, specializes in IoT and biomedical signal analysis. His final year project focused on an IoT-based emergency rescue system using life jackets. Jakarea has also worked as a researcher under Prof. Sami Azam from Charles Darwin University, contributing to the development of an integrative framework for myocardial infarction diagnosis using ECG signals, combining advanced signal analysis, feature extraction, and graph convolutional networks.
education: B.S. in EEE, United International University

graduate_research.name: Most Marufatul Jannat Mim
graduate_research.title: Graduate Researcher
graduate_research.shortDescription: Most Marufatul Jannat Mim received her Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science and Engineering from United International University (UIU) in 2024. She is actively involved in research activities related to computer vision, deep learning, medical image analysis, explainable artificial intelligence, and machine learning. Her passion lies in pioneering innovative research in computer science. Apart from her studies, she was involved in co-curricular activities with the UIU App Forum, where she served as President, demonstrating strong leadership by organizing various seminars and workshops for computer science students.
education: B.S. in EEE, United International University

undergraduate_research.name: Debopom Sutradhar

His recent projects include a cervical spine fracture detection system using YOLOv8 paired with a deep attention-based vertebrae classification method to ensure explainable AI. He also developed a lightweight encoder approach for predicting future changes in satellite imagery via semi-supervised learning. Debopom is currently working on CT scan denoising using reinforcement learning.
education: B.S. in Computer Science, United International University
